intro: Scaevola glabra, commonly known as the common scaevola, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, soft hairs. Scaevola glabra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
